segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome to EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 大家好，欢迎来到EnglishPod。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
segments.cn: 我叫Marco。

segments.en: My name is Katherine.
segments.cn: 我叫Katherine。

segments.en: And today we have an upper intermediate level lesson.
segments.cn: 今天我们有一节中高级水平的课程。

segments.en: It's kind of bitter.
segments.cn: 有点苦涩。

segments.en: It's a little bit sad, but it's also kind of sweet.
segments.cn: 有点悲伤，但也有点甜。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: We have a lesson today all about getting a divorce or divorcing someone.
segments.cn: 今天的课程是关于离婚的。

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: So this is what happens when two people's marriage ends.
segments.cn: 这就是两个人的婚姻结束时发生的事情。

segments.en: They decide they want to leave each other.
segments.cn: 他们决定要分开。

segments.en: They have a divorce.
segments.cn: 他们离婚。

segments.en: So let's take a listen to today's dialogue, and we'll be back in a moment.
segments.cn: 现在让我们听听今天的对话，稍后再回来。

segments.en: Joanne, let's not make this divorce any more acrimonious than it already is, okay?
segments.cn: Joanne，别让这次离婚变得更加尖锐，好吗？

segments.en: Let's just get down to business and start dividing this stuff up fairly so we can go our separate ways, all right?
segments.cn: 我们直接开始分配这些东西，这样我们就可以各自走各自的路，好吗？

segments.en: Fine with me.
segments.cn: 我没问题。

segments.en: I just want to get this over with.
segments.cn: 我只想尽快结束这一切。

segments.en: It's important we make a clean break.
segments.cn: 我们需要干脆利落地结束。

segments.en: I should have signed a prenup.
segments.cn: 我应该签个婚前协议。

segments.en: What was that?
segments.cn: 什么？

segments.en: Nothing.
segments.cn: 没什么。

segments.en: Anyway, you're right.
segments.cn: 不管怎样，你说得对。

segments.en: There's no reason this has to be nasty.
segments.cn: 没必要让这变得恶劣。

segments.en: My lawyer tells me that you've accepted our alimony proposal and the division of property, as well as the custody agreement.
segments.cn: 我的律师告诉我，你已经接受了我们的赡养费提议、财产分配和监护协议。

segments.en: I keep the cat, and you get the dog.
segments.cn: 我养猫，你养狗。

segments.en: So that's done.
segments.cn: 所以这就解决了。

segments.en: Finally.
segments.cn: 最后。

segments.en: Let's not go there, Joanne.
segments.cn: 我们别再提这个了，Joanne。

segments.en: Okay, so let's start with the record collection.
segments.cn: 好吧，那我们先从唱片收藏开始。

segments.en: I'll take the albums I contributed, and you can have your cheesy disco albums back.
segments.cn: 我拿我贡献的专辑，你可以拿回你的老式迪斯科专辑。

segments.en: Fine, but I'm keeping the antique gramophone as my grandfather gave it to me.
segments.cn: 好吧，但我会保留那个古董留声机，因为是我祖父送给我的。

segments.en: I believe that was a wedding present to both of us, Joanne, and you hardly ever use it.
segments.cn: 我相信那是我们俩的婚礼礼物，Joanne，而且你几乎从不使用它。

segments.en: He's my grandfather, and he never really liked you anyway.
segments.cn: 他是我祖父，他其实并不喜欢你。

segments.en: Whatever.
segments.cn: 随便。

segments.en: Alright, I'll concede the silly gramophone if you'll agree that I get the silver tea set.
segments.cn: 好吧，如果你同意我拿到银茶具，我就让步给那个愚蠢的留声机。

segments.en: How typical.
segments.cn: 真典型。

segments.en: When are you ever going to use a silver tea set?
segments.cn: 你什么时候会用到银茶具？

segments.en: Fine.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: I don't want to drag this out any more than necessary.
segments.cn: 我不想拖延这件事。

segments.en: What's next?
segments.cn: 接下来是什么？

segments.en: What about these old photographs?
segments.cn: 这些旧照片呢？

segments.en: Which ones?
segments.cn: 哪些？

segments.en: Let me have a look.
segments.cn: 让我看看。

segments.en: Oh wow, look at that.
segments.cn: 哦，哇，看看这个。

segments.en: That brings back memories.
segments.cn: 这让我想起了很多回忆。

segments.en: Remember that?
segments.cn: 还记得吗？

segments.en: Our trip to Italy.
segments.cn: 我们去意大利的旅行。

segments.en: I remember that day.
segments.cn: 我记得那天。

segments.en: We were going to visit the Trevi Fountain, and we got caught in the rain.
segments.cn: 我们要去特雷维喷泉，结果被雨淋到了。

segments.en: And you looked so adorable with your hair all wet.
segments.cn: 你那时看起来真可爱，头发全湿了。

segments.en: I had to take a picture of you standing there in that little alley, smiling and laughing in the rain.
segments.cn: 我不得不拍下你在小巷里站着，笑着在雨中。

segments.en: Oh, we really did have fun back then, didn't we?
segments.cn: 哦，那时候我们真的很开心，不是吗？

segments.en: Oh, Joanne, are we making a big mistake?
segments.cn: 哦，Joanne，我们是不是在犯大错？

segments.en: I know our relationship has been on the rocks for some time, but are you sure we can't reconcile and try again?
segments.cn: 我知道我们的关系已经岌岌可危，但你确定我们不能和解再试一次吗？

segments.en: I still love you.
segments.cn: 我仍然爱你。

segments.en: Oh, Jeff, I love you too.
segments.cn: 哦，Jeff，我也爱你。

segments.en: I'm so glad we didn't have to decide who keeps the motorcycle.
segments.cn: 我真高兴我们不需要决定谁来保留摩托车。

segments.en: The motorcycle?
segments.cn: 摩托车？

segments.en: But that's mine.
segments.cn: 但那是我的。

segments.en: Alright, we're back.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们回来了。

segments.en: So now why don't we take a look at six key words on language takeaway.
segments.cn: 现在我们来看看六个关键的语言词汇。

segments.en: Language takeaway.
segments.cn: 语言词汇。

segments.en: Okay, Marco, this first word is what we call an SAT word.
segments.cn: 好的，Marco，第一个词是我们所说的SAT词。

segments.en: That means it's.
segments.cn: 这意味着...

segments.en: So the sentence starts off by saying, let's not make this divorce any more acrimonious than it already is.
segments.cn: 所以句子开始时说，让我们不要让这次离婚变得更加尖锐。

segments.en: This divorce is very acrimonious, but let's not make it worse.
segments.cn: 这次离婚非常尖锐，但我们不要让它更糟。

segments.en: Okay, so acrimonious would be... Bitter.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以尖锐就是... 苦涩。

segments.en: Bitter, very complicated.
segments.cn: 苦涩，非常复杂。

segments.en: Hard.
segments.cn: 难。

segments.en: So people are emotional about it.
segments.cn: 所以人们对此很情绪化。

segments.en: You know, people, Joanne and Jeff, are getting a divorce.
segments.cn: 你知道，Joanne和Jeff正在离婚。

segments.en: They're very angry at each other.
segments.cn: 他们彼此非常生气。

segments.en: So they're not having a peaceful divorce.
segments.cn: 所以他们的离婚并不平和。

segments.en: This is the opposite.
segments.cn: 这正好相反。

segments.en: It's very bitter.
segments.cn: 非常苦涩。

segments.en: It's very angry.
segments.cn: 非常愤怒。

segments.en: Can you say this test is very acrimonious?
segments.cn: 你能说这次考试非常尖锐吗？

segments.en: No.
segments.cn: 不能。

segments.en: Usually relationships are acrimonious.
segments.cn: 通常关系是尖锐的。

segments.en: For example, ever since they had that big fight, Jeff and Joanne's relationship has been very acrimonious.
segments.cn: 例如，自从他们大吵一架以来，Jeff和Joanne的关系一直非常尖锐。

segments.en: Okay, awesome.
segments.cn: 好吧，太棒了。

segments.en: So acrimonious, a very hard word there.
segments.cn: 所以尖锐是一个非常难的词。

segments.en: As you say, many people study it to pass exams in order to go into college.
segments.cn: 正如你所说，很多人学习它以通过考试进入大学。

segments.en: So now you know.
segments.cn: 所以现在你知道了。

segments.en: Now moving on, we have a very common legal term.
segments.cn: 现在继续，我们有一个非常常见的法律术语。

segments.en: When people are getting married, they want to sign sometimes a prenup.
segments.cn: 当人们结婚时，他们有时想签一个婚前协议。

segments.en: Yeah, you said it's common.
segments.cn: 是的，你说这很常见。

segments.en: You hear this a lot in movies and TV.
segments.cn: 你在电影和电视中经常听到。

segments.en: Yeah, with celebrities.
segments.cn: 是的，关于名人。

segments.en: Yeah, you read about celebrities.
segments.cn: 是的，你会读到名人。

segments.en: So basically, a prenup is a short way of saying a prenuptial agreement.
segments.cn: 所以基本上，婚前协议是婚前协议的简写。

segments.en: Nuptial means having to do with marriage.
segments.cn: 婚姻意味着与婚姻有关。

segments.en: So basically, if you sign a prenup, you are agreeing to certain conditions before you get married.
segments.cn: 所以基本上，如果你签了婚前协议，你是在同意在结婚前的某些条件。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: It's a contract between future husband and future wife about what happens if they divorce.
segments.cn: 这是未来丈夫和未来妻子之间的合同，关于他们离婚时会发生什么。

segments.en: For example, I decided not to get a prenup with my fiance because I don't think we'll get divorced.
segments.cn: 例如，我决定不和我的未婚夫签婚前协议，因为我认为我们不会离婚。

segments.en: But maybe he decided to get a prenup because in case they divorce, he wants to keep his car.
segments.cn: 但也许他决定签婚前协议，因为如果他们离婚，他想保留他的车。

segments.en: Right, so it usually happens a lot with celebrities, as we say, because they have a lot of money.
segments.cn: 对，所以这通常发生在名人身上，因为他们有很多钱。

segments.en: And if they get divorced, then usually it can get complicated, how much money the spouse gets, etc.
segments.cn: 如果他们离婚，通常会变得复杂，配偶能得到多少钱等等。

segments.en: So maybe their prenuptial agreement or prenup will be that if they get divorced, the wife may get maybe a million dollars instead of a hundred million dollars.
segments.cn: 所以他们的婚前协议可能是，如果他们离婚，妻子可能会得到一百万美元，而不是一亿美元。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: It's a way many people protect themselves financially in case of divorce.
segments.cn: 这是许多人在离婚时保护自己财务的一种方式。

segments.en: Very good.
segments.cn: 非常好。

segments.en: Now moving on, another legal term and related to money is an alimony.
segments.cn: 现在继续，另一个与金钱相关的法律术语是赡养费。

segments.en: Okay, so let's look at the context of this word.
segments.cn: 好的，让我们看看这个词的上下文。

segments.en: Joanne is talking and she says, My lawyer tells me you've accepted our alimony proposal.
segments.cn: Joanne在说，她的律师告诉我你接受了我们的赡养费提议。

segments.en: Alimony.
segments.cn: 赡养费。

segments.en: So this is probably something to do with money, right?
segments.cn: 所以这可能与金钱有关，对吧？

segments.en: So she said that her lawyer has proposed an alimony and that's usually a settlement, an amount of money that you agree on when you get divorced.
segments.cn: 她说她的律师提议了赡养费，这通常是离婚时达成的和解金额。

segments.en: Right, so this is exactly it.
segments.cn: 对，所以这正是如此。

segments.en: In a divorce, this is how much money one person will pay the other.
segments.cn: 在离婚中，这就是一个人将支付给另一个人的金额。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So if two people are married and when they get divorced, their alimony may be the husband.
segments.cn: 所以如果两个人结婚，离婚时，赡养费可能是丈夫支付的。

segments.en: If he's got a lot of money, he will pay an alimony of $500,000.
segments.cn: 如果他有很多钱，他将支付50万美元的赡养费。

segments.en: Right, and so this is different from property, which is the next thing.
segments.cn: 对，所以这与财产不同，财产是下一个话题。

segments.en: Division of property means that you talk about who will receive the car, the house, things like that.
segments.cn: 财产分割意味着你讨论谁将获得汽车、房子等。

segments.en: Okay, very good.
segments.cn: 好的，非常好。

segments.en: So very complicated situations when you're getting divorced, prenups and alimony.
segments.cn: 所以在离婚时情况非常复杂，婚前协议和赡养费。

segments.en: But moving on, they were talking about custody as well.
segments.cn: 但继续，他们也在谈论监护权。

segments.en: Custody of maybe children, maybe custody of their pets.
segments.cn: 可能是孩子的监护权，也可能是宠物的监护权。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So you talk about alimony.
segments.cn: 所以你谈论赡养费。

segments.en: This is money.
segments.cn: 这是钱。

segments.en: Property, which is things.
segments.cn: 财产，是物品。

segments.en: But what about people and animals?
segments.cn: 但人和动物呢？

segments.en: This is called custody.
segments.cn: 这被称为监护权。

segments.en: I want custody.
segments.cn: 我想要监护权。

segments.en: Custody means caring for something or looking after something.
segments.cn: 监护权意味着照顾或照料某物。

segments.en: You could say the child is in the grandmother's custody.
segments.cn: 你可以说孩子在祖母的监护下。

segments.en: Okay, so in the care of the grandmother.
segments.cn: 好的，所以在祖母的照顾下。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So usually, as well, when people get divorced, somebody gets custody of the children.
segments.cn: 所以通常，当人们离婚时，某人会获得孩子的监护权。

segments.en: Right, so he wants custody, but he doesn't have a job, so she will receive custody.
segments.cn: 对，所以他想要监护权，但他没有工作，所以她将获得监护权。

segments.en: You could say that.
segments.cn: 你可以这么说。

segments.en: In this case, though, we're talking about custody of pets, animals.
segments.cn: 不过在这种情况下，我们谈论的是宠物的监护权，动物。

segments.en: Right, in this case, it's animals.
segments.cn: 对，在这种情况下，是动物。

segments.en: But it's actually true, right?
segments.cn: 但这实际上是对的，对吧？

segments.en: People, when they get divorced, they may ask the court for custody of their pets.
segments.cn: 人们在离婚时，可能会向法院申请宠物的监护权。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: And sometimes custody is what makes a divorce extremely acrimonious.
segments.cn: 有时监护权会使离婚变得极其尖锐。

segments.en: Yes, who gets to keep the children, who gets to keep the pets.
segments.cn: 是的，谁能保留孩子，谁能保留宠物。

segments.en: Now, moving on, and a little bit away from legal terms, they were dividing up their property and saying, well, I get to keep this, you get to keep that.
segments.cn: 现在，继续，稍微远离法律术语，他们在分割财产，说，我保留这个，你保留那个。

segments.en: And Joanne said, I'm keeping the antique gramophone as my grandfather gave it to me.
segments.cn: Joanne说，我要保留这台古董留声机，因为是我祖父送给我的。

segments.en: Ha, so who cares about pets and money?
segments.cn: 哈，那谁在乎宠物和钱？

segments.en: I want the gramophone.
segments.cn: 我想要留声机。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: All right, so this is actually a word you don't hear very often anymore.
segments.cn: 好吧，这实际上是一个你不常听到的词。

segments.en: It's an old thing, and that's what antique means, right?
segments.cn: 这是一个古老的东西，这就是古董的意思，对吧？

segments.en: Antique is old.
segments.cn: 古董是旧的。

segments.en: Right, so antique, this is an adjective here.
segments.cn: 对，所以古董，这里是一个形容词。

segments.en: It can also be a noun.
segments.cn: 它也可以是名词。

segments.en: An antique table, an antique gramophone is something that's very old, like 100 years old or 150 years old.
segments.cn: 一张古董桌子，一台古董留声机是非常旧的东西，比如100年或150年。

segments.en: And a gramophone is one of those machines that you see in movies that play the old vinyl records and has like a big horn where the sound echoes.
segments.cn: 留声机是你在电影中看到的那种播放旧黑胶唱片的机器，带有一个大喇叭，声音在里面回响。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So in the 19th century, early 20th century, people didn't have CDs or MP3s or iPods.
segments.cn: 所以在19世纪，20世纪初，人们没有CD、MP3或iPod。

segments.en: This is how they listened to music.
segments.cn: 这就是他们听音乐的方式。

segments.en: So you usually have a hand crank, you have to turn the machine, and then the music will play, and you can dance and do whatever.
segments.cn: 所以你通常有一个手摇曲柄，你必须转动机器，然后音乐就会播放，你可以跳舞或做其他事情。

segments.en: Right, so that's a gramophone.
segments.cn: 对，这就是留声机。

segments.en: Now moving on to our last word, Jeff said, you know what?
segments.cn: 现在继续到我们的最后一个词，Jeff说，你知道吗？

segments.en: Okay, fine, keep the gramophone.
segments.cn: 好吧，好的，保留留声机。

segments.en: All right, I'll concede the silly gramophone.
segments.cn: 好吧，我让步这台愚蠢的留声机。

segments.en: So to concede.
segments.cn: 所以让步。

segments.en: To concede means to give up an argument.
segments.cn: 让步意味着放弃争论。

segments.en: Okay, so you give up, you give in, you say, all right, take it.
segments.cn: 好的，所以你放弃，你妥协，你说，好吧，拿去吧。

segments.en: That's exactly right.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: So in this case, the argument is who will receive the gramophone?
segments.cn: 所以在这种情况下，争论是谁将获得留声机？

segments.en: They fight, they argue, and finally, Jeff says, I concede, okay?
segments.cn: 他们争吵，争论，最后，Jeff说，我让步，好吗？

segments.en: I give up.
segments.cn: 我放弃。

segments.en: You take it.
segments.cn: 你拿去吧。

segments.en: And is it only for things, or can you also concede someone, like you say somebody is right?
segments.cn: 这只是针对物品，还是你也可以让步某人，比如你说某人是对的？

segments.en: You can say that, or an election.
segments.cn: 你可以这么说，或者在选举中。

segments.en: For example, there are two people who want to be president, and the vote is counted, and it's not clear who the president is, and one person says, fine, I concede.
segments.cn: 例如，有两个人想要成为总统，投票被计算，结果不清楚谁是总统，其中一个人说，好吧，我让步。

segments.en: That means I give up, you win.
segments.cn: 这意味着我放弃，你赢。

segments.en: Okay, very good.
segments.cn: 好的，非常好。

segments.en: So to concede.
segments.cn: 所以让步。

segments.en: All right, six key words there.
segments.cn: 好吧，这里有六个关键词。

segments.en: They're very interesting, especially the legal terms.
segments.cn: 它们非常有趣，尤其是法律术语。

segments.en: Very common, and it's very...
segments.cn: 非常常见，了解这些对你下次观看相关主题的电影非常有用。

segments.en: It's very common, and it's very useful for you to know next time you're watching maybe a movie or something related to this topic.
segments.cn: 希望不是下次你离婚的时候。

segments.en: Hopefully not the next time you're getting divorced.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 现在让我们继续四个关键短语，供大家在流利表达中使用。

segments.en: Let's move on now to four key phrases that we have for everyone on Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 流利表达Marco，让我们结束这件事。

segments.en: Fluency Builder Marco, let's get this over with.
segments.cn: 我累了。

segments.en: I'm tired.
segments.cn: 我想回家。

segments.en: I want to go home.
segments.cn: 啊，让我们结束这件事。

segments.en: Ah, let's get it over with.
segments.cn: 来吧，快点做完。

segments.en: Come on, just do it and get it over with.
segments.cn: 好吧，这就是我们在流利表达中的第一个短语。

segments.en: All right, so this is our first phrase in Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 结束这件事，或者说结束它。

segments.en: Okay, so let's take that as a phrase, and to get something over with means let's just finish it quickly, let's stop delaying.
segments.cn: 好的，所以我们把这个作为一个短语，结束某事意味着让我们快速完成它，停止拖延。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: This is a way to ask to finish something quickly or to stop something.
segments.cn: 这是一种要求快速完成某事或停止某事的方式。

segments.en: For example, I have to go to the dentist later.
segments.cn: 例如，我稍后要去看牙医。

segments.en: Maybe I really don't want to go.
segments.cn: 也许我真的不想去。

segments.en: I'll say to myself, let me just get this over with and once it's done, I don't have to worry about it.
segments.cn: 我会对自己说，让我赶快结束这件事，一旦完成，我就不用担心了。

segments.en: Or maybe you have homework to do and instead of doing it later, you're like, okay, I'm going to do it now and just get it over with.
segments.cn: 或者也许你有作业要做，而不是稍后再做，你会说，好吧，我现在就做，赶快结束这件事。

segments.en: All right, to get over with, to get something over with.
segments.cn: 好吧，结束这件事，结束某事。

segments.en: And when they were talking about breaking up or separating, Joanne mentioned it's important we make a clean break.
segments.cn: 当他们谈论分手或分开时，Joanne提到我们要做一个干脆的了断。

segments.en: What does she mean by making a clean break?
segments.cn: 她所说的干脆了断是什么意思？

segments.en: All right, we hear this phrase all the time.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们经常听到这个短语。

segments.en: It's a very important phrase.
segments.cn: 这是一个非常重要的短语。

segments.en: In relationships, it means when two people leave each other, you don't then call them or see each other or hang out.
segments.cn: 在关系中，这意味着当两个人分开时，你们不再打电话、见面或一起出去。

segments.en: It means a clean break.
segments.cn: 这意味着彻底断绝。

segments.en: You stop altogether.
segments.cn: 你完全停止。

segments.en: You stop something completely.
segments.cn: 你完全停止某事。

segments.en: So you don't talk anymore, you don't see each other anymore, you completely just stop contact with each other.
segments.cn: 所以你们不再交谈，不再见面，完全停止联系。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: You can also say this about breaking something.
segments.cn: 你也可以用这个来形容打破某物。

segments.en: You could say it was a clean break.
segments.cn: 你可以说这是一个彻底的断裂。

segments.en: When I broke my arm, it was a clean break.
segments.cn: 当我摔断手臂时，那是一个彻底的断裂。

segments.en: There were no little pieces of bone or any problems.
segments.cn: 没有小骨头或任何问题。

segments.en: It was a clean break.
segments.cn: 那是一个彻底的断裂。

segments.en: That means completely broke.
segments.cn: 这意味着完全断裂。

segments.en: Okay, so when we talk about clean break in a relationship, it means we completely break up, we stop talking to each other, and it's over with.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以当我们谈论关系中的彻底断绝时，这意味着我们完全分手，停止交谈，结束了。

segments.en: It's in the past.
segments.cn: 这已经是过去的事了。

segments.en: Alright, so moving on, they were talking and completely arguing about I get the gramophone, I get the tea set.
segments.cn: 好吧，继续，他们在争论我拿留声机，我拿茶具。

segments.en: And Joanne said, Okay, fine.
segments.cn: 乔安说，好吧，没问题。

segments.en: I don't want to drag this out any longer than necessary.
segments.cn: 我不想再拖延下去了。

segments.en: So you can hear her.
segments.cn: 所以你可以听到她。

segments.en: I don't want to drag this out any longer than necessary.
segments.cn: 我不想再拖延下去了。

segments.en: So to drag something out means to extend, to make something longer, to make something take more time than it should.
segments.cn: 所以拖延某事意味着延长，让某事比应该的时间更长。

segments.en: Okay, so for example, if someone's giving a speech, they may be dragging it out.
segments.cn: 好吧，例如，如果有人在演讲，他们可能在拖延。

segments.en: So if someone's giving a very long speech, you're like, Oh my God, he's dragging this speech out so long.
segments.cn: 所以如果有人在做一个非常长的演讲，你会想，哦，我的天，他把这个演讲拖得太长了。

segments.en: Yeah, when will he ever stop?
segments.cn: 是啊，他什么时候才能停下来？

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: Or you could say, in an argument, I'm tired of arguing, let's not drag this out anymore, let's just stop.
segments.cn: 或者你可以说，在争论中，我厌倦了争论，别再拖延了，咱们就停止吧。

segments.en: So to drag something out is usually time related, to make things longer than necessary.
segments.cn: 所以拖延某事通常与时间有关，让事情比必要的时间更长。

segments.en: And for our last phrase, when Jeff was talking about the relationship, he says, I know a relationship has been on the rocks for some time.
segments.cn: 对于我们的最后一个短语，当杰夫谈论关系时，他说，我知道这段关系已经岌岌可危一段时间了。

segments.en: Okay, so the relationship was on the rocks.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以这段关系岌岌可危。

segments.en: Okay, so this is an interesting phrase.
segments.cn: 好吧，这是一个有趣的短语。

segments.en: Think about rocks.
segments.cn: 想想岩石。

segments.en: You know, you see rocks on the ground in the ocean.
segments.cn: 你知道，你在地面和海洋中看到岩石。

segments.en: Something that's on the rocks, in this case, means something that is not going well.
segments.cn: 在这种情况下，岌岌可危意味着某事进展不顺利。

segments.en: Something that has problems.
segments.cn: 某事有问题。

segments.en: Yes, it's not smooth.
segments.cn: 是的，不顺利。

segments.en: So when Jeff says our relationship has been on the rocks, he's saying, we fight a lot, we have problems, it's not working.
segments.cn: 所以当杰夫说我们的关系岌岌可危时，他在说，我们经常争吵，我们有问题，这段关系不行。

segments.en: So if I say, my company has been on the rocks recently, it means it's not doing very well.
segments.cn: 所以如果我说，我的公司最近岌岌可危，这意味着它的表现不好。

segments.en: Business is not going well.
segments.cn: 生意不好。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So you can use this for different things.
segments.cn: 所以你可以用这个来形容不同的事情。

segments.en: Now, obviously you may have heard it before for drinks, you say, scotch on the rocks.
segments.cn: 现在，显然你可能以前听过饮料，你会说，威士忌加冰。

segments.en: Right, that's different.
segments.cn: 对，那是不同的。

segments.en: Be careful.
segments.cn: 小心。

segments.en: In that sentence, Mark was talking about ice.
segments.cn: 在那句话中，马克在谈论冰。

segments.en: Right?
segments.cn: 对吧？

segments.en: So that's different if you ask for a drink on the rocks.
segments.cn: 所以如果你要求饮料加冰，那是不同的。

segments.en: But if you describe yourself or your company or your relationship as being on the rocks, it means you're having a tough time.
segments.cn: 但是如果你形容自己、你的公司或你的关系岌岌可危，那意味着你正在经历困难。

segments.en: It's a bad situation.
segments.cn: 这是一个糟糕的情况。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: So it's a very useful phrase.
segments.cn: 所以这是一个非常有用的短语。

segments.en: I think that's very native, very colloquial if you say something like this.
segments.cn: 我认为如果你说这样的事情，它非常地道，非常口语化。

segments.en: Absolutely.
segments.cn: 绝对如此。

segments.en: It's a great phrase to use.
segments.cn: 这是一个很好的短语。

segments.en: I encourage you, I mean I hope that your situation, your work and your relationships are not on the rocks.
segments.cn: 我鼓励你，我希望你的情况、工作和关系不是岌岌可危。

segments.en: But I do hope that when you're practicing speaking, use this phrase a lot because it's really, really colloquial like you say, Marco.
segments.cn: 但我确实希望当你练习说话时，多使用这个短语，因为它真的非常口语化，就像你说的，马尔科。

segments.en: Yeah, it's really good.
segments.cn: 是的，真的很好。

segments.en: So I think we've taken a look at a lot of phrases, a lot of vocab.
segments.cn: 所以我认为我们已经看了很多短语，很多词汇。

segments.en: Why don't we go back, listen to the dialogue for one last time.
segments.cn: 我们为什么不回去，再听一次对话呢？

segments.en: Joanne, let's not make this divorce any more acrimonious than it already is, okay?
segments.cn: 乔安，别让这场离婚变得更加尖锐，好吗？

segments.en: Let's just get down to business and start dividing this stuff up fairly so we can go our separate ways, alright?
segments.cn: 我们就直接开始分配这些东西，以便我们可以各自走各自的路，好吗？

segments.en: Fine with me.
segments.cn: 我没问题。

segments.en: I just want to get this over with.
segments.cn: 我只想尽快结束这件事。

segments.en: It's important we make a clean break.
segments.cn: 重要的是我们要彻底断绝关系。

segments.en: Should have signed a prenup.
segments.cn: 应该签个婚前协议。

segments.en: What was that?
segments.cn: 什么？

segments.en: Nothing.
segments.cn: 没什么。

segments.en: Anyway, you're right.
segments.cn: 不管怎样，你是对的。

segments.en: There's no reason this has to be nasty.
segments.cn: 没理由让这变得恶劣。

segments.en: My lawyer tells me that you've accepted our alimony proposal and the division of property as well as the custody agreement.
segments.cn: 我的律师告诉我，你已经接受了我们的赡养费提议、财产分配以及监护协议。

segments.en: I keep the cat and you get the dog.
segments.cn: 我养猫，你养狗。

segments.en: So that's done.
segments.cn: 所以这就解决了。

segments.en: Finally.
segments.cn: 最后。

segments.en: Well let's not go there, Joanne.
segments.cn: 好吧，乔安，别再提这个了。

segments.en: Okay, so let's start with the record collection.
segments.cn: 好吧，那我们从唱片收藏开始吧。

segments.en: I'll take the albums I contributed and you can have your cheesy disco albums back.
segments.cn: 我拿我贡献的专辑，你可以把你的低俗迪斯科专辑拿回去。

segments.en: Fine, but I'm keeping the antique gramophone as my grandfather gave it to me.
segments.cn: 好吧，但我会保留古董留声机，因为是我祖父送给我的。

segments.en: I believe that was a wedding present to both of us, Joanne.
segments.cn: 我相信那是我们俩的婚礼礼物，乔安。

segments.en: And you hardly ever use it.
segments.cn: 而且你几乎从来不使用它。

segments.en: He's my grandfather.
segments.cn: 他是我祖父。

segments.en: And he never really liked you anyway.
segments.cn: 而且他其实从来不喜欢你。

segments.en: Whatever.
segments.cn: 随便。

segments.en: Alright, I'll concede the silly gramophone if you'll agree that I get the silver tea set.
segments.cn: 好吧，如果你同意我拿银茶具，我就让步给这个愚蠢的留声机。

segments.en: How typical.
segments.cn: 多么典型。

segments.en: When are you ever going to use a silver tea set?
segments.cn: 你什么时候会用到银茶具？

segments.en: Fine.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: I don't want to drag this out any more than necessary.
segments.cn: 我不想再拖延下去了。

segments.en: What's next?
segments.cn: 接下来是什么？

segments.en: What about these old photographs?
segments.cn: 这些旧照片呢？

segments.en: Which ones?
segments.cn: 哪些？

segments.en: Let me have a look.
segments.cn: 让我看看。

segments.en: Oh wow, look at that.
segments.cn: 哦，哇，看看这个。

segments.en: That brings back memories.
segments.cn: 这让我想起了回忆。

segments.en: Remember that?
segments.cn: 记得那个吗？

segments.en: Our trip to Italy.
segments.cn: 我们去意大利的旅行。

segments.en: I remember that day.
segments.cn: 我记得那天。

segments.en: We were going to visit the Trevi Fountain and we got caught in the rain.
segments.cn: 我们要去参观特雷维喷泉，却被雨淋到了。

segments.en: And you looked so adorable with your hair all wet.
segments.cn: 你湿漉漉的样子真可爱。

segments.en: I had to take a picture of you standing there in that little alley smiling and laughing in the rain.
segments.cn: 我不得不拍下你在小巷里微笑着、在雨中欢笑的样子。

segments.en: Oh, we really did have fun back then didn't we?
segments.cn: 哦，我们当时真的很开心，不是吗？

segments.en: Oh, Joanne.
segments.cn: 哦，乔安。

segments.en: Are we making a big mistake?
segments.cn: 我们是不是犯了个大错？

segments.en: I know our relationship has been on the rocks for some time but are you sure we can't reconcile and try again?
segments.cn: 我知道我们的关系已经岌岌可危一段时间了，但你确定我们不能和解再试一次吗？

segments.en: I still love you.
segments.cn: 我仍然爱你。

segments.en: Oh Jeff, I love you too!
segments.cn: 哦，杰夫，我也爱你！

segments.en: I'm so glad we didn't have to decide who keeps the motorcycle.
segments.cn: 我真高兴我们不需要决定谁来保留摩托车。

segments.en: The motorcycle?
segments.cn: 摩托车？

segments.en: But that's mine!
segments.cn: 但那是我的！

segments.en: Alright, we're back.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们回来了。

segments.en: So a very interesting dialogue all about divorce.
segments.cn: 所以这是一个关于离婚的非常有趣的对话。

segments.en: Now, this is a very common situation nowadays in many countries such as the United States or Europe.
segments.cn: 现在，这在许多国家，如美国或欧洲，是一种非常普遍的情况。

segments.en: Divorce rates are very high lately, like in the past 10-20 years.
segments.cn: 最近离婚率很高，像过去10-20年一样。

segments.en: Yeah, they do say that since maybe the 70s or 80s divorce rates have been on the rise.
segments.cn: 是的，他们确实说自70年代或80年代以来，离婚率一直在上升。

segments.en: I think the average now in America is about 50%.
segments.cn: 我认为现在美国的平均离婚率大约是50%。

segments.en: Yeah, it's like 5 in 10 marriages end in divorce.
segments.cn: 是的，差不多每10对婚姻中就有5对离婚。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: And then from what I understand or I read once, I think out of those 50% that get divorced, if they remarry, again, the probabilities of those that get remarried are again half.
segments.cn: 然后根据我了解或曾经读到的，我认为在那些离婚的50%中，如果他们再婚，重新结婚的概率又是二分之一。

segments.en: So, most likely people will get divorced at least twice.
segments.cn: 所以，大多数人可能会至少离婚两次。

segments.en: That's true.
segments.cn: 这是真的。

segments.en: Although, sometimes you meet people who got married when they were very very young and they realized that they grew up a little bit and their personality changed or their goals changed and they divorced that one time but then later in life when they marry again they know who they are.
segments.cn: 不过，有时你会遇到那些在非常年轻时结婚的人，他们意识到自己长大了一点，性格或目标发生了变化，他们离婚了一次，但后来在生活中再婚时，他们知道自己是谁。

segments.en: They get married again and it's better.
segments.cn: 他们再次结婚，情况会更好。

segments.en: So, I think the situations are all quite different but it is true that there are a lot of divorces in America.
segments.cn: 所以，我认为情况各不相同，但在美国确实有很多离婚。

segments.en: What about Ecuador though?
segments.cn: 那厄瓜多尔呢？

segments.en: I mean is the divorce rate similar?
segments.cn: 我是说离婚率相似吗？

segments.en: No, not really.
segments.cn: 不，实际上并不是。

segments.en: I think people are still a little bit more old fashioned in that sense.
segments.cn: 我认为人们在这方面仍然有点保守。

segments.en: Like it was before, you know it was even a little bit taboo to be divorced.
segments.cn: 就像以前一样，你知道，离婚甚至有点禁忌。

segments.en: But I don't think people get divorced as often.
segments.cn: 但我认为人们离婚的频率并不高。

segments.en: Especially if people have been together for quite a while.
segments.cn: 特别是如果人们在一起很长时间。

segments.en: That's one of the things that surprises me a lot is I've met people who have been married 20-30 years and then get divorced.
segments.cn: 让我感到惊讶的是，我遇到过那些结婚20-30年后才离婚的人。

segments.en: It's like you've been through the toughest times you've pretty much beat the odds and why do you get divorced at such a late age?
segments.cn: 就像你经历了最艰难的时刻，几乎打破了几率，为什么在这么晚的年龄离婚？

segments.en: Yeah, it does seem counterintuitive but it's possible that they were unhappy for that time and they didn't want to affect their children's lives.
segments.cn: 是的，这似乎是反直觉的，但他们可能在那段时间不快乐，不想影响孩子的生活。

segments.en: And so when their children go to college or leave they say, okay now I can make a big decision.
segments.cn: 所以当他们的孩子上大学或离开时，他们说，好吧，现在我可以做一个重大决定。

segments.en: I know in countries for example such as Chile, divorce is still illegal.
segments.cn: 我知道在一些国家，比如智利，离婚仍然是非法的。

segments.en: I think in the Philippines as well.
segments.cn: 我想在菲律宾也是。

segments.en: Really?
segments.cn: 真的？

segments.en: Yeah, it's still illegal to get divorced.
segments.cn: 是的，离婚仍然是非法的。

segments.en: Is that because they're very religious countries?
segments.cn: 这是因为他们是非常宗教的国家吗？

segments.en: I know Chile is not really that religious.
segments.cn: 我知道智利并不是特别宗教。

segments.en: I don't know what it is exactly by law but a lot of people... I think it may be legal now.
segments.cn: 我不太清楚法律上是什么，但很多人……我想现在可能是合法的。

segments.en: I can't really remember very well.
segments.cn: 我记不太清楚了。

segments.en: I think one of our Chilean listeners can help us out here.
segments.cn: 我想我们的智利听众可以帮我们解答。

segments.en: But I know a lot of people used to annul their marriages because of this.
segments.cn: 但我知道很多人因为这个原因选择宣告婚姻无效。

segments.en: I see.
segments.cn: 我明白了。

segments.en: So they would be like, oh I put the wrong address.
segments.cn: 所以他们会说，哦，我填错了地址。

segments.en: So no, this marriage is not valid.
segments.cn: 所以不，这段婚姻无效。

segments.en: Or I spelled my name wrong.
segments.cn: 或者我拼错了我的名字。

segments.en: Interesting.
segments.cn: 有趣。

segments.en: Well I'd be curious to know whether any Brazilian friends know more about this or for the rest of you in your country is divorce common?
segments.cn: 我很好奇是否有巴西朋友知道更多关于这个的，或者在你们的国家，离婚普遍吗？

segments.en: Is it uncommon?
segments.cn: 是不常见吗？

segments.en: Are there laws that prohibit or that allow divorce?
segments.cn: 有没有法律禁止或允许离婚？

segments.en: Let us know on our website EnglishPod.com Alright, we'll see you guys there.
segments.cn: 请在我们的网站 EnglishPod.com 告诉我们。好吧，我们在那里见。

segments.en: Bye.
segments.cn: 再见。
